results.title: Tess the old girl
results.brief_description: Charming story about the amazing Tess and how she went from lost dog’s home to breakfast around the Tan, RSPCA Million Paws Walks, holidays and even bumping into the odd celebrity. This much loved dog has become part of the family and enjoys nothing better than chasing trucks , barking at possums, and pulling clothes off the line. Spoilt she may be but everyone loves the old girl.

results.title: Judy Maddigan
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Lisetta Moscardo and Helen Simondson
results.brief_description: Judy Maddigan was the first woman Deputy Speaker and was the first woman to be appointed the Speaker of The Legislative Assembly in Victoria in 2003. Maddigan has a strong commitment to community and was elected as a Member of Parliament to represent the Electoral District of Essendon in the Legislative Assembly in 1996. During her time as speaker Maddigan implemented many changes in the 150 year old parliament to improve the lives of workers and also public accessibility. She is a librarian at heart and is currently the Member for Essendon.

results.title: The People's land
results.creator_credit: Ralph Keene, Donald Taylor and Strand Films
results.brief_description: In Britain the National Trust has acqired a number of estates and areas of land of historical interest: they include ancient castles, such as the 14th century Bodian castle, a Chiltern village, the famous valley of Dovedale, a number of prehistoric stone circles, 14,000 acres of Westmorland countryside and an extensive area of downland in Sussex. These estates and landmarks are held in public trust forever.

results.title: Game Masters: Paulina Bozek interview
results.creator_credit: Jim Arneman, ACMI Media Studio, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Paulina Bozek started her career at Ubisoft in Montreal, Canada, before moving to Sony as the Executive Producer of the ‘SingStar’ franchise for PlayStation. Currently she is CEO and co-founder at INENSUA, responsible for overseeing the creative direction and team management for the development of social games and applications. A self-confessed casual gamer, Paulina studied film and communication and has always been interested in pop culture and the combination of technology and entertainment. In this interview she discusses her preference for working on long term projects, as well as the importance of user feedback and engaging the audience early in the development process.

In this interview Paulina talks about ‘SingStar’, ‘Closet Swap’ and her new project ‘Super Fan’. NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Game Masters: Tetsuya Mizuguchi interview
results.creator_credit: Jim Arneman, ACMI Media Studio, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Tetsuya Mizuguchi started in the industry working for SEGA developing arcade games such as ‘Sega Rally’. In 1994 he was inspired by the street parades in Zurich and soon turned his love of synaesthesia, combining sound and vision, to produce the games ‘Rez’ and ‘Space Channel 5’. Mizuguchi continues to incorporate a notable emphasis on interactive sound design, with his latest game ‘Child of Eden’.

Currently he is co-founder of the videogame development firm Q Entertainment. NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Interview with Christopher Doyle
results.brief_description:
Australian cinematographer Christopher Doyle talks about how time operates in his filmmaking, how life experience has shaped his work, the role of repetition, structure and movement in cinematogrpahy, how space informs and influences his technique, and about the collaborative process of filmmaking.
Includes clips from ‘Paranoid Park’ 2007; ‘Days of Being Wild’ (A Fei zheng chuan), 1990; ‘Happy Together’ (Chun gwong cha sit), 1997; ‘In the Mood for Love’ (Fa yeung nin wa), 2000; and ‘Fallen Angels’ (Duo luo tian shi), 1995.

results.title: Going, going, still here!
results.creator_credit: Garry Hammer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Garry Hammer and his family battle the Gippsland bushfires to save their home.
Garry’s story is a personal account of the fire front that swept through his property, creating its own weather, a life-threatening yet positive force that ultimately gave him a new perspective on his life and his relationship with his son.
This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.
